QR_Module.f90

00001 !******************************************************************************
00002 ! Module to perform QR decomposition
00003 !******************************************************************************
00004 ! REQUIRED FILES:
00005 ! PRECISION_VARS.F90            *DEFINES PRECISION FOR ALL VARIABLES
00006 !******************************************************************************
00007 
00008       module QR_Module
00009 
00010       use precision_vars, only : wp
00011 
00012       implicit none
00013 
00014       public    ::  qrdcmp, qrsolv
00015       private
00016       
00017       contains
00018 
00019 !==============================================================================
00020 
00021       SUBROUTINE qrdcmp(a,n,np,c,d,sing)
00022 
00023       INTEGER,                     intent(in   ) :: n,np
00024       REAL(wp),  dimension(np,np), intent(inout) :: a
00025       REAL(wp),  dimension(n),     intent(  out) :: c,d
00026       LOGICAL,                     intent(  out) :: sing
00027 
00028       !  Constructs the QR decomposition of a(1:n,1:n) , with physical dimension np .  The upper
00029       !  triangular  matrix R is returned in  the upper triangle  of a , except for the diagonal elements
00030       !  of R which are returned in d(1:n) .  The orthogonal matrix Q is represented as a product of
00031       !  n - 1 Householder matrices Q 1 ::: Q n - 1 ,where Q j = 1 - u j ?  u j =c j .The i th component
00032       !  of u j is zero for i =1 ;:::;j - 1 while the nonzero components are returned in a(i,j) for
00033       !  i = j;:::;n .  sing returns  as  true  if  singularity  is  encountered during  the decomposition,
00034       !  but  the  decomposition  is  still  completed  in  this  case.
00035 
00036       INTEGER                                    :: i,j,k
00037       REAL(wp)                                   :: scl,sigma,wrk,tau
00038 
00039       sing=.false.
00040       do k=1,n-1
00041         scl=0.0_wp
00042         do i=k,n
00043           scl=max(scl,abs(a(i,k)))
00044         enddo
00045         if(scl.eq.0.)then
00046           sing=.true.
00047           c(k)=0.0_wp
00048           d(k)=0.0_wp
00049         else
00050           do i=k,n
00051             a(i,k)=a(i,k)/scl
00052           enddo
00053           wrk=0.0_wp
00054           do i=k,n
00055             wrk=wrk+a(i,k)**2
00056           enddo
00057           sigma=sign(sqrt(wrk),a(k,k))
00058           a(k,k)=a(k,k)+sigma
00059           c(k)=sigma*a(k,k)
00060           d(k)=-scl*sigma
00061           do j=k+1,n
00062             wrk=0.0_wp
00063             do i=k,n
00064               wrk=wrk+a(i,k)*a(i,j)
00065             enddo
00066             tau=wrk/c(k)
00067             do i=k,n
00068               a(i,j)=a(i,j)-tau*a(i,k)
00069             enddo
00070           enddo
00071         endif
00072       enddo
00073       d(n)=a(n,n)
00074       if(d(n).eq.0.0_wp)sing=.true.
00075       
00076       END subroutine qrdcmp
00077 
00078 !==============================================================================
00079 
00080       SUBROUTINE qrsolv(a,n,np,c,d,b)
00081 
00082       implicit none
00083 
00084       INTEGER,                     intent(in   ) :: n,np
00085       REAL(wp),  dimension(np,np), intent(inout) :: a
00086       REAL(wp),  dimension(n),     intent(in   ) :: c,d
00087       REAL(wp),  dimension(n),     intent(inout) :: b
00088 
00089 !     USES rsolv
00090 !      Solves the set of n linear equations A x = b ,where a is a matrix with physical dimension np.
00091 !      a , c ,and d are input  as  the output of the routine qrdcmp and  are not modi ed.  b(1:n)
00092 !      is input as the right-hand side vector, and is overwritten with the solution vector on output.
00093 
00094       INTEGER        ::  i,j
00095       REAL(wp)       ::  wrk,tau
00096 
00097       do j=1,n-1                            !  Form Q^T . b
00098         wrk=0.0_wp
00099         do i=j,n
00100           wrk=wrk+a(i,j)*b(i)
00101         enddo
00102         tau=wrk/c(j)
00103         do i=j,n
00104           b(i)=b(i)-tau*a(i,j)
00105         enddo
00106       enddo
00107       call rsolv(a,n,np,d,b)                   !  Solve R x = Q^T b
00108       
00109       END subroutine qrsolv
00110 
00111 !==============================================================================
00112 
00113       SUBROUTINE rsolv(a,n,np,d,b)
00114 
00115       INTEGER,                     intent(in   ) :: n,np
00116       REAL(wp),  dimension(np,np), intent(inout) :: a
00117       REAL(wp),  dimension(n),     intent(in   ) :: d
00118       REAL(wp),  dimension(n),     intent(inout) :: b
00119 
00120 !     Solves the set of n linear  equations R x = b ,where R is an upper triangular  matrix stored
00121 !     in a and d .  a and d are input  as  the output  of the routine qrdcmp and  are not modified.
00122 !     b(1:n) is  input  as  the  right-hand  side  vector, and  is  overwritten  with the  solution  vector
00123 !     on  output.
00124 
00125       INTEGER                                    :: i,j
00126       REAL                                       :: wrk
00127 
00128       b(n)=b(n)/d(n)
00129       do i=n-1,1,-1
00130         wrk=0.0_wp
00131         do j=i+1,n
00132           wrk=wrk+a(i,j)*b(j)
00133         enddo
00134         b(i)=(b(i)-wrk)/d(i)
00135       enddo
00136       
00137       end subroutine rsolv
00138 !==============================================================================
00139       end module QR_Module
